p: We used climate data from WorldClim v.1.4 because it includes both current and future climate conditions ( http://worldclim.org/version1) [ 41]. We selected a subset of five of the 19 available climate variables within the WorldClim dataset, based on expert knowledge of the biology of these vectors [ 27, 42â€“ 44]. In the models, we included annual trends (Bio12: annual precipitation), seasonality (Bio7: temperature annual range) and limiting or extreme environmental factors (Bio2: mean temperature diurnal range; Bio10: mean temperature of warmest quarter; Bio11: mean temperature of coldest quarter) [ 27]. We used the data at 30 arc-second spatial resolution (approximately 1 km 2 at the equator).
